episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics, including Bulgaria's unique method of using rockets to combat hail, the surprising influence of visual cues on music judgment, Roald Dahl's creative parenting and inventions, and the current state of animal performances in UK circuses.

facts.fact: Bulgaria has an agency that shoots rockets to kill hail, to kill it.
We judge music more on how it looks than how it sounds.
The BFG's Dream Powder also helps against constipation.
Britain has only one performing circus raccoon.
